comments:
This may belong in BIRT, depending on how the error is fixed.  I added here since the problem would best be fixed in the ODA components.

If you create a RunTime DataSource using the templates, and fill in one of the property values, and you do not implement a Designer plug-in, then you will throw a runtime exception when the report runs.  Although this is not the end of the world, some users may find this confusing.  The stack dump from this does only reference the property binding in a cursory manner, mostly their is a lot of info about Javascript errors.

It would be best if this were fixed so that the report could run even if there is a property value in the data source with no UI component built.  

The next best solution would be to provide better error logging stating that the UI interface needs to be implemented.  




Feb 23, 2007 4:07 PM
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The following items have errors:

Scott, please attach a BIRT report design that can reproduce this issue.

The ODA framework itself does not impose any requirement of an ODA UI implementation for a data source property value. So the issue lies in the ODA consumer application... and perhaps how the data source element is defined in the BIRT report design.

Hi Scott,

Any update?

Thanks.
Lin

Hi Scott,

We cannot reproduce the bug. And as we have not received any message from you so far, we will close the bug by now. Please feel free to reopen it in case of necessary.

Thanks.
Lin
